```{r load csv, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  results='asis', 
  echo = FALSE
)
library(tidyverse)
library(glue)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
source('parsing_functions.R')

# Set this to true to have links turned into footnotes at the end of the document
PDF_EXPORT <- T
links <- c()

position_data <- read_delim("positions.csv", ";", escape_double = FALSE, trim_ws = TRUE, skip_empty_rows = TRUE) %>% 
  filter(in_resume) %>% 
  mutate(
    # Build some custom sections by collapsing others
    section = case_when(
      section %in% c('research_positions', 'industry_positions') ~ 'positions', 
      section %in% c('data_science_writings', 'by_me_press') ~ 'writings',
      section %in% c('Projects') ~ 'projects',
      section %in% c('Oter_activity') ~ 'activity',
      TRUE ~ section
    )
  )

intro_text <- read_delim("omschrijvingen.csv", ";", escape_double = FALSE, 
                         trim_ws = TRUE, skip_empty_rows = TRUE) %>%
  filter(Print) %>% pull(intro_eng) %>% paste(collapse = "\n\n") 

skills <-read_delim("skills.csv", ";", escape_double = FALSE, 
                         trim_ws = TRUE, skip_empty_rows = TRUE) %>% filter(Print) 

```
